SEARCH
Package oogasalad.fileparser

Class PropertyParser

java.lang.Object
oogasalad.fileparser.PropertyParser
public class PropertyParser extends Object
The PropertyParser class is responsible for parsing XML elements that represent properties. It provides public methods to parse both double and string properties contained in designated XML nodes.

By default, property children are expected to have the tag name "data". However, overloaded methods allow clients to specify an alternative child tag (for example, "property" when using the format <properties><property>...</property></properties>).

Example usage: 

   Element blueprintElement = ...; // your XML blueprint element
   PropertyParser parser = new PropertyParser();
   // Using the default "data" tag:
   Map<String, Double> doubleProps = parser.parseDoubleProperties(blueprintElement);
   Map<String, String> stringProps = parser.parseStringProperties(blueprintElement);

   // Using a custom child tag "property":
   Map<String, Double> doublePropsAlt =
   parser.parseDoubleProperties(blueprintElement, "property");
   Map<String, String> stringPropsAlt =
   parser.parseStringProperties(blueprintElement, "property");

    • PropertyParser

      public PropertyParser()

  • Method Details

    • parseDoubleProperties

      public Map<String,Double> parseDoubleProperties(Element objectNode, String propertiesTag, String childTag) throws PropertyParsingException
      Parses the <doubleProperties> element containing child elements with the given tag holding property data.
      Parameters:
      objectNode - the XML element containing the <doubleProperties> node.
      childTag - the tag name of the child elements holding property data.
      Returns:
      a map with property names and their corresponding double values.
      Throws:
      PropertyParsingException - if the node is not found or if a value cannot be parsed as a double.

    • parseStringProperties

      public Map<String,String> parseStringProperties(Element objectNode, String propertiesTag, String childTag) throws PropertyParsingException
      Parses the <stringProperties> element containing child elements with the given tag name holding property data.
      Parameters:
      objectNode - the XML element containing the <stringProperties> node.
      childTag - the tag name of the child elements holding property data.
      Returns:
      a map with property names and their corresponding string values.
      Throws:
      PropertyParsingException - if the node is not in the expected format.

    • parseProperties

      private <T> Map<String,T> parseProperties(Element parentNode, String propertiesTag, String childTag, Function<String,T> converter, String errorPrefix) throws PropertyParsingException
      Parses the XML element containing property data into a map whose values have been converted using the provided converter function.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the property value.
      Parameters:
      parentNode - the element that contains the properties node.
      propertiesTag - the tag name of the properties node (e.g., "doubleProperties" or "stringProperties").
      childTag - the tag name of the child elements holding property data.
      converter - a Function to convert property values from String to the desired type.
      errorPrefix - error message prefix if conversion fails.
      Returns:
      a map of property names to their converted values.
      Throws:
      PropertyParsingException - if the node is not found or if a conversion fails.

    • getPropertiesElement

      private Element getPropertiesElement(Element parentNode, String propertiesTag) throws PropertyParsingException
      Retrieves the properties element from the blueprint node using the specified tag.
      Parameters:
      parentNode - the element that contains the properties node.
      propertiesTag - the tag name of the properties node.
      Returns:
      the properties element if present; null otherwise.
      Throws:
      PropertyParsingException - if the node is found but is not an element.

    • processDataNodes

      private <T> Map<String,T> processDataNodes(Element propertiesElement, String childTag, Function<String,T> converter, String errorPrefix) throws PropertyParsingException
      Processes all child nodes of the given properties element and returns a map of property names to their converted values.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the property value.
      Parameters:
      propertiesElement - the element containing the child property nodes.
      childTag - the tag name of the child elements to process.
      converter - a Function to convert property values from String to the desired type.
      errorPrefix - error message prefix if conversion fails.
      Returns:
      a map of property names to converted values.
      Throws:
      PropertyParsingException - if any child node is not in the expected format.

    • processDataElement

      private <T> void processDataElement(Element dataElement, Map<String,T> properties, Function<String,T> converter, String errorPrefix) throws PropertyParsingException
      Processes a single property element by extracting its name and value, converting the value using the provided converter, and placing it into the properties map.

      If the "value" attribute is missing or empty, the element's text content will be used instead.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the property value.
      Parameters:
      dataElement - the property element.
      properties - the map that collects the properties.
      converter - a Function to convert the property value from String to the desired type.
      errorPrefix - error message prefix if conversion fails.
      Throws:
      PropertyParsingException - if the conversion fails.

    • isIgnorableNode

      private boolean isIgnorableNode(Node node)
      Checks whether the given node is ignorable (i.e., a text node containing only whitespace).
      Parameters:
      node - the node to check.
      Returns:
      true if the node is ignorable; false otherwise.
